metadata.titel_preek: At Midnight: A Way Out of Fear, Greed, and Abuse

kernfrasen: proclaim to you a way of salvation
another way to live in the world

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The prison is a metaphor for keeping the lid on trouble.

doeldomein.theologisch_concept: The Status Quo / Sinful Social Order

cognitieve_implicaties: The hearer feels trapped by societal expectations.
theologische_implicaties: Salvation is not just internal but structural liberation.
ethische_implicaties: Resisting the status quo is a form of jailbreaking.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May imply that all civil order is inherently oppressive.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'prison' image by linking it to modern 'Orange Alerts' and 'talk shows'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon consistently uses the 'Prison/Freedom' and 'Path/Way' metaphors to bridge the biblical text with modern socio-economic critique.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The jailer washing wounds (medical) is presented as the act of 'buoyant generosity' (economic/relational) that breaks the 'prison' of greed.

sterktes.beschrijving: Transforms the dead metaphor of 'salvation' into a living 'way out' of specific modern anxieties.
sterktes.voorbeeld: What do I have to do to be saved? ... how to be in sync with the rule of God in your daily life.

risicos.beschrijving: The strong focus on 'money men' and 'magistrates' might lead the hearer to see salvation purely as political/economic reform.
risicos.voorbeeld: The whole future of the world (and of our economy) turns on his question.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Reduction of the Gospel to a political manifesto.

sub_worlds: Modern media landscape (talk shows, Supreme Court)
The 'Old World' of death vs. the 'Easter World' of life

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates a mirror effect between the two worlds.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: God is the one who shakes foundations and breaks chains.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Explicitly denies the 'pie in the sky' definition.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with Eastertide themes of resurrection and new life.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the JOURNEY and CONTAINER domains. It successfully maps the physical confinement of a first-century jail to the psychological and economic confinement of the 21st century. The 'Way' metaphor serves as the bridge between these two states.

revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Describe the actual rhythm of the 'drummer'â€”the pace of a life not driven by the 'Orange Alert'.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift from 'shaking foundations' (destruction) to 'washing wounds' (healing).
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly link the 'quake' to the 'breaking of the hard heart' so the healing makes sense as a follow-up.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If society is a prison, then the jailer is a villain.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize that the jailer is also a prisoner of the system (as the sermon does well) to maintain grace.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'shaking foundations' with 'growth' and 'planting' of the new community.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The growth of the household of faith.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to deconstruct modern idols and reconstruct a vibrant, embodied Easter faith.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'midnight' imagery, CMT shows how 'midnight' functions as a 'Container of Darkness' that God ruptures.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning, CMT focuses on how the 'money men' metaphor physically structures the hearer's perception of greed.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher treats 'Fear' as a physical location one can 'walk out of'.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'SOCIETY IS A MARKETPLACE' source domain to critique modern capitalism.
